## Introduction

--- &singleimage w1:90 image:images/Phase2Tracker.png

## The Phase 2 Detector for the TP

* The Phase 2 detector is composed of the <font class="violet bold">
Phase 1 pixel detector</font> plus a new outer tracker and <font
class="violet bold"> extended forward disks</font>.
    * The Outer tracker consists of <font
	class="blue bold">pixel-strip</font> or <font
	class="red bold">strip-strip</font> modules, allowing for an L1 track trigger.

    * The extended forward disks (4-10) are replications of standard forward
disks (1-3). Disks 8-10 only have an outer disk.

--- .smaller &singleimage w1:60 image:images/BadModulesPhase1_1000fb-1.png

## Scenarios investigated

* Three main samples are used to evaluate results:
    * ttbar + 140PU for general results
	* single particle gun with 10 muons per event + 140PU for muon efficiency with high pileup
    * single particle gun with 10 muons per event + 0PU for studies of number of hits and resolution
* Three scenarios are shown:
    * Phase 1: current outer tracker, phase 1 pixel detector, no aging of any detector.
    * Phase 1 with strip aging: as Phase 1 with strip aged to $1000~\textrm{fb}^{-1}$ (main effect is to kill TIB1, TIB2, TOB1, TOB2). Pixel detector is unaged.
    * Phase 2: Phase 1 pixel detector, phase 2 outer tracker,
 forward disk extension.

---

## Details of Reconstruction Software

* The phase 1 results come from 6_2_0_SLHC12.  
* The phase 2 results come from 6_2_0_SLHC14 plus Kevin's hack
to emulate binary readout of the outer tracker (which generally has a
small effect).
* The Phase 1(in high PU conditions) and Phase 2 track reconstruction is very
similar.
* The same track iterations are used (except that one of the
muon recovery iterations is not included in phase 2). 
    * high pT quad step (pT>0.8 GeV), 
	* high pT triplet step (pT>0.9 GeV), 
	* low pT quad step (pT>0.35 GeV), 
	* low pT triplet step (pT>0.45 GeV), 
	* detached quad step (pT>0.5 GeV, d0<0.5 cm), 
	* pixel pair step (pT>1.5 GeV), muon recovery. 
* The main differences are:
    * addition of seeds for the extended forward
disks;
    * some tuning of the final selection cuts to account for some 
features of the phase 2 tracker.
    * a reconstruction more tailored to lower PU scenario (<100PU) for
      the Phase1, using OuterSiStripTracker seeding.
* Results are obtained using the reconstruction scenarios that give the most
  meaningful comparisons.

## Motivation for the Upgraded Tracker

After $1000~\textrm{fb}^{-1}$ of collected data, the current Outer
Tracker performaces degrade considerably, spoiling physics reach of
searches using tracks and degrading quantities like jet resolution and
isolation criteria.
